com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class Selection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.Selection

  • public final class Selection
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a set of selected date cells and defines a visualization style applied to the selected elements.

    • Method Summary

      • set

        public void set(DateTime start,
                DateTime end,
                Resource resource)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Selects a range of date cells for a specified resource.

        Either all of the parameters contact, resource, location and task must be set to null or only one of them should be a non-null reference.

        Parameters:
        start - Specifies the first date in the range.
        end - Specifies the last date in the range.
        resource - A reference to a Resource to associate the selection with.

      • set

                DateTime end,
                Resource[] resources)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Selects a range of date cells associated with the specified resources.
        Parameters:
        start - Specifies the first date in the range.
        end - Specifies the last date in the range.
        resources - The resources associated with the specified interval.

        public boolean contains(DateTime date)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Determines whether the specified date is currently selected.
        Parameters:
        date - A date to search for in the selection.
        Returns:
        true if the date's cell is selected; otherwise false.

        Description copied from class: Selection
        Determines whether any part of the specified day is selected.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getSelectedElementsStyle

        public Style getSelectedElementsStyle()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets the visualization style to apply to selected elements.
        Returns:
        A Style object specifying the style applied to selected calendar cells. This cannot be null.

      • setSelectedElementsStyle

        public void setSelectedElementsStyle(Style value)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Sets the visualization style to apply to selected elements.
        Parameters:
        value - A Style object specifying the style applied to selected calendar cells. This cannot be null.

      • getIsEmpty

        public boolean getIsEmpty()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets a value indicating whether this selection is empty.
        Returns:
        true if there are selected calendar cells; otherwise, false.

      • getRanges

        public java.util.List<DateTime> getRanges()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets a read-only collection of DateTime objects, sorted chronologically. Each pair in the collection represents a selected time range.
        Returns:
        Any attempt to modify this connection will result in an exception.

      • getDayRanges

        public java.util.List<DateTime> getDayRanges()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets a read-only collection of DateTime objects, sorted chronologically. Each pair in the collection represents an interval of selected days.

        Any attempt to modify this connection will result in an exception.

        Returns:
        An instance of the List class containing even number of DateTime objects.

      • getAllowMultiple

        public java.lang.Boolean getAllowMultiple()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets a value indicating whether users are allowed to select multiple elements at a time.
        Returns:
        true to allow multiple selection; otherwise, false.

      • setAllowMultiple

        public void setAllowMultiple(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to select multiple elements at a time.
        Parameters:
        value - true to allow multiple selection; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getContinuous

        public java.lang.Boolean getContinuous()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets a value indicating whether users can select only one range of dates in the calendar.
        Returns:
        true to prevent users from selecting more than one, continuous range of dates in the component; otherwise, false.

      • setContinuous

        public void setContinuous(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Sets a value indicating whether users can select only one range of dates in the calendar.
        Parameters:
        value - true to prevent users from selecting more than one, continuous range of dates in the component; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getEnabled

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnabled()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets a value indicating whether users are allowed to select any cells in the calendar.
        Returns:
        true if users are allowed to select calendar cells; otherwise, false.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to select any cells in the calendar.
        Parameters:
        value - true if users are allowed to select calendar cells; otherwise, false. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        Description copied from class: Selection
        Sets the style of the selection frame drawn around selected calendar cells.
        Parameters:
        value - One of the SelectionStyle constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getResource

        public Resource getResource()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets the resource related to the current selection.
        Returns:
        The resource related to the current selection or if there are no selected cells or the current selection is not associated with a resource.

      • getResources

        public Resource[] getResources()
        Description copied from class: Selection
        Gets the resources related to the current selection.

        This property is relevant in Resource view with enabled multiple grouping.

        Returns:
        A list with all related resources.
